persona.name: Marcus Ellington
persona.role: Office manager at a 30-person accounting firm (existing Comcast Business customer)
persona.goal: Get routed correctly to handle an internet outage/slow speeds and find the support portal for troubleshooting.
persona.context: It’s mid-day during tax season and their connection is unstable, impacting VoIP calls and access to cloud accounting tools. He’s frustrated and wants immediate help, not a sales callback.

turns.content: Hi, I need help with a Comcast Business internet issue that’s disrupting our office right now—can you point me to the right place to get this fixed fast?
I hear you—that's frustrating. For immediate help, visit https://business.comcast.com/support/home/ or call our 24/7 support line. They'll sort it out.

messages: I hear you—that's frustrating. For immediate help, visit https://business.comcast.com/support/home/ or call our 24/7 support line. They'll sort it out.

turns.content: I don’t have time to poke around a website right now—where exactly on that support page do I go to run diagnostics or report an outage? Also, what’s the direct number for business support so I can get a human on the line immediately?

I hear you—that’s frustrating. On the support page, select **“Report an Outage”** under the Internet section to run diagnostics and submit a report. For immediate help, call our 24/7 Business Support line at 1‑800‑741‑4141. You can also start the process at https://business.comcast.com/support/home/.

turns.content: One last thing—where in the portal do I find ongoing outage status once I’ve reported it? I need to know if this is just us or a wider issue so I can update my partners.

I hear you—knowing if it’s just your office or a wider issue is key. After you submit a report, go to the Service Status Center at https://business.comcast.com/status/. It shows any ongoing outages for your account and the surrounding area, so you can update your partners with the latest info.
